title: Canceling People Only Makes Them More Successful
description:
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community

Subscribe on Youtube:

channel_info.title: Michael Sartain
channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast 

🔥Teaching you how to build a network of desirable women and high-status men

👇 Click the "Men of Action" link below now to forge a high-status lifestyle and join the elites

transcription: {"text": "Full disclosure, I like Andrew. We talk on a couple times when he says women are property. My mom is nobody's property. So it's hard for me to stand up when he says I don't want the 19th Amendment repealed, and women pick me up in their cars. I have some female friends with really nice cars. They pick me up in their cars, and they drive the, I don't care. So it's a little different for me, but I still, I like him, and the idea of canceling him is absurd. When they canceled Alex Jones, it tripled his revenue on InfoWars. When they canceled Donald Trump, he became the most Googled person in the world. Cancel culture doesn't work. This is where I'm planting my flag. I will literally and figuratively die for this one. Freedom of speech has two sides to it. One side is the good, happy ideas, right? The idea of a free market economy, or Charles Darwin's idea of evolution, right? This is free speech. A lot of churches didn't like that idea. The religious sect didn't like when Galileo was saying that the earth goes around the sun. Free speech has a good side to it. Free speech also has the part where idiots go up there and say stupid shit. I want to hear dumb people say stupid.
